settings.body: In 1983, we made the first synthetic chamois and forever changed cycling apparel. Since then, we’ve been on a mission to continue innovating where it matters most. Our top-end chamois technology sets a new bar for performance-minded riders, and we apply the same thinking and quality standards to all price points because everyone should ride in comfort.

settings.heading: Levitate™ Series
settings.body: The Levitate™ family represents our latest innovation in chamois technology. By combining a multi-density Suspension Core™, super-soft 1:1® Boundary Layer top sheet, and seamless Infinite Edge™ transition, the Levitate lets you float through road and trail chatter so you’ll never bottom out.

settings.title: Next Gen Suspension Core™
settings.text: Multiple density chamois provide the best balance of support and comfort, but leveraging the properties of different densities to significantly improve ride quality has largely remained untapped. Until now. Our new Next Gen Suspension Core smoothly supports your body weight during stable pedaling, and cushions even with impacts up to 4x the force. The result is a chamois that helps you float over bumps, potholes and road chatter. And so the Levitate name was born.

settings.title: 1:1® Boundary Layer
settings.text: A chamois needs to solve two problems: damping road imperfections and reducing pedaling friction. Our 1:1 Boundary Layer is the enemy of friction. It moves with you dynamically and quickly wicks moisture off your skin to keep you dry. To help it perfectly match your body, the Suspension Core is attached just at the front and rear, so that the two layers can move independently, settling into the best position to keep in comfortable contact.  We also increased the overall footprint of the Boundary Layer based on tester feedback to ensure that it stays between you and your bike at all times. You’ll feel like this chamois is always in the right spot.

settings.title: Infinite Edge™
settings.text: The best chamois disappear while you’re riding. So our goal is to make sure you don’t feel anything that could cause discomfort down the road, including transitions from firm to soft or thick to thin within the chamois. We carefully cut away excess material to reduce bulk and create a smooth taper that blends seamlessly, which we call Infinite Edge. All you’ll feel is supportive comfort.

settings.title: Dynamic Relief Channel™
settings.text: For years riders have benefited from center line pressure-reducing saddles. Our new Levitate chamois takes this concept to the next level with the Dynamic Relief Channel, which holds its pressure-relieving shape no matter how the chamois bends and flexes under the rider. You’ll feel support where you want it and nothing where you don’t.

settings.title: Innovate to Levitate
settings.text:
You can find the all new Levitate chamois in a wide range of our latest bibs and shorts. The full-featured Levitate PRO with Next Generation Suspension Core is used in the updated premium PRO collection. We’ve applied the same innovative thinking to a single layer Levitate chamois for our best-selling Quest shorts. Once you ride with the Levitate, you’ll never go back. 

Beat gravity, ride Levitate.

settings.title: Levitate PRO
settings.text: The pinnacle of comfort and performance, this chamois pad offers more support with better stretch and breathability than any on the market. The PRO Next-Gen Suspension Core® uses ultra-high-density layers to distribute your body weight over a larger area for more comfort, even deep into a ride when most chamois are packed out. It features our softest, highest stretch 1:1 Boundary Layer that moves with you in and out of the saddle to minimize friction. Whether you’re riding for one hour or twelve, nothing rides better.

settings.title: Levitate PLUS
settings.text: With a ride quality similar to the PRO, this chamois pad delivers comfort and performance that’s on par or better than most high-end offerings. The PLUS Next-Gen Suspension Core uses high-density layers to distribute your body weight over a larger area for more comfort, even deep into a ride when most chamois are packed out. It features a moisture-wicking 1:1 Boundary Layer that moves with you in and out of the saddle to minimize friction. This is a daily driver chamois that is ready to go the distance.

settings.title: Levitate
settings.text: Based on the same design philosophy as the more premium PRO and PLUS, this chamois pad delivers incredible performance at a more accessible price point. The key difference is that it’s cut from a single layer of medium-density material, with a thicker cross-section providing comfortable support to the most high-pressure areas. An integrated boundary layer keeps soft, fast-drying fabric next to the skin to minimize friction. This chamois punches above its weight, delivering a ride on par with most mid-range offerings.

settings.title: Escape 1:1® Collection
settings.text: Released in 2016, the Escape 1:1 chamois platform introduced two-piece construction, with a Suspension Core providing cushioning support and a floating top sheet to reduce friction. It redefined next-to-skin comfort and all-day support without feeling bulky.

settings.text_1: This premium chamois features a high-density, three-layer suspension core, and an independent, ultra-soft top sheet. The PRO chamois promises plush support even on the longest rides.
settings.text_2: A high-density, two-layer Suspension Core and independent, next-to-skin top sheet layer work together to deliver reliable, long-ride supportive comfort.
settings.text_3: A single-layer chamois features mid-level support, designed with an emphasis on next-to-skin comfort and breathability.

settings.heading: We Design With Three Goals in Mind:

settings.title: REDUCE FRICTION
settings.text: Cycling is repetitive, so we use high stretch materials, soft face fabrics, and an innovative floating top layer to smooth the movement between your body and the saddle.

settings.title: PROVIDE SUPPORT
settings.text: While riding, a considerable amount of weight is concentrated on the sit bones, which are about the size of a quarter. Our suspension core design distributes this pressure evenly across a wider area to prevent hot spots and improve long-distance comfort.

settings.title: KEEP SKIN DRY
settings.text: We choose specialized, highly breathable layers to allow moisture to move freely away from your body, maintaining skin health and a chafe-free riding experience.

settings.heading: Our love for mountain biking is best summed up in two words: More Trail
settings.body: More trail is about pushing your boundaries to become a more complete rider and getting more out of the MTB experience—going farther, riding faster, finding more confidence, and getting involved.

settings.title: To get more out of your riding,
settings.text: Sometimes it helps to look at the trail with your feet on the ground. The unique satisfaction that comes from building or repairing trails mirrors riding in some ways—the buzz of physical exertion, fresh air in the lungs, and a very real connection with the earth. But the most meaningful result is the feeling that you’ve earned it on your next ride. Most of us don’t know what goes into creating trail when we first start riding, we just know that a great trail is a lot more fun to ride. Turns out, they can be pretty fun to build too.

settings.title: DIG IN
settings.text: With so many local advocacy groups leading the charge in different regions, it can be hard for riders and first-time trail stewards to know where to look to get involved. That’s why we’re teaming up with IMBA’s trail advocacy group finder, a tool to find build days, fundraisers and advocacy groups across the nation. Because like many of the best things in life, it feels like the more you give to the MTB community the more you get back.

settings.title: the 501 Trail Pledge
settings.text: Our team has committed to logging 500 hours of stewardship work and trail building each year. But we’re not stopping there. We’re donating 1% of all MTB gear sales to local trail advocacy groups, based on the zip code where the sale occurred. So when you choose PEARL iZUMi gear you are helping all of us get more trail.

settings.title: WE CHALLENGED OURSELVES to create a line of apparel that can take your riding to the next level.
Summit
settings.text: Our Summit collection blurs the line between apparel and equipment, nailing the details so you are free to reset your limits. Employing breathable, lightweight technical fabrics, these pieces help you keep your cool, while bonded sleeve and leg openings provide next-to-skin comfort. Expand your boundaries and get more trail.

settings.title: Canyon
settings.text: Mountain biking is about more than the ride. With technical pieces that shift easily between riding and after-outing hangs, our Canyon collection is there for all aspects of the riding experience. We know that pockets designed to work best on the bike are really great on the bike, but on a barstool? Not as much. Our Canyon line has all the pedaling performance you need without broadcasting, “I’ve been mountain biking today.”

settings.title: Elevate
settings.text: One way to experience more trail is to find a different way to ride it, or expand what you consider rideable. This collection is for those who choose their own line. Made with guards in mind, the Elevate series integrates seamlessly with protection and boosts fabric durability to let you test the edges of your unique riding ability.

settings.title: protection
settings.text: Find confidence and push your limits on new terrain to open up more trail possibilities with our low profile knee and elbow guards. Designed with venting solutions and a fit perfected for all day riding, they are made to stay comfortably in place so you won’t have to stop to pad up. This means they’ll be there when you need them, not in your pack. Despite the sleek design, we don’t skimp on safety and each pair promises CE level 1 protection.

settings.heading: WE
settings.body:
WE is a movement to build community and an acknowledgment that we’re stronger together. It’s a call to take cycling in a new direction where women feel empowered at every level of the sport. By creating a hub that brings together groups and individuals that have been working alone, we can harness that collective energy and work toward a shared vision, together. By building community, we can create a sport where strength in numbers is greater than strength in watts, where Women Empower Women Empower Women…

WE have nothing to prove and everything to gain. We’re moving for change and loving the ride.

Let’s do this.

settings.title: the we ride finder is here!
settings.text: Getting started can be the hardest part. Our women’s group ride finder is here to help you learn about riding opportunities in your area. From casual gravel spins to performance-oriented road teams and MTB meet-ups, find like-minded cyclists in your area and get rolling!

settings.title: Hear the Stories
settings.text: Sharing stories often leads to uncovering common ground. As part of our mission to expand the cycling community, we’re sharing stories of challenge, growth and connection from a host of women riders. While each story offers the unique perspective of one individual, we hope you find a few kernels of universal truth that resonate with you.

settings.cta_title_1: A Space for All: Brooke Goudy’s Mission for Representation in MTB
settings.cta_text_1: Brooke Goudy is on a mission to not have to talk about how representation matters. Getting all people to “acknowledge and understand barriers, and that we, all folks, white folks, black folks, brown folks, are out there working our hardest to remove those barriers.”
settings.cta_title_2: An Unconventional Journey to Unbound Gravel 2021
settings.cta_text_2: I’m not a math major, but by my calculations, I’ve done approximately 25% of what I need to do to prepare for this beast of a race. Unbound Gravel is no joke. It requires respect and preparation.
settings.cta_title_3: Marley Blonsky is Taking Her Vision for Cycling to Arkansas
settings.cta_text_3: Co-founder of All Bodies on Bikes and PI Ambassador Marley Blonsky has seen a lot of doors open in the last year. As she preps to relocate from Seattle, WA to Fayetteville, AR she reflects on three pivotal moments during her time in the evergreen state.

settings.cta_title_1: Rowdy Gowdy - Empowering Women in MTB
settings.cta_text_1: How many ideas are you putting off and saying you’ll do someday? Folks often have big dreams that never make it into reality. In 2017 I took that big first step and made my rad idea happen.
settings.cta_title_2: Riding Bikes Into and Through Pregnancy
settings.cta_text_2: Each year in May we celebrate moms with their own day. This year, we wanted to shine a light on moms who balance motherhood with their need to ride while maintaining healthy pregnancies and happy babies.
settings.cta_text_3: I’m one of hopefully many people who’ve had the pleasure of hearing professional cyclist Ayesha McGowan speak about the cycling industry and how it represents people of color.

settings.title: At their best, bikes give us the freedom to be ourselves, together.
settings.text:
Because we want to make it easier for female riders to find community and make connections in cycling, we’ve created a Hub that brings together resources for women at every level of the sport. For trail, gravel, and road, we’re compiling ride groups, meetups and teams that seek to empower women and foster connection. We’re moving forward and riding together

—Let’s go!

settings.heading: Designed by women for women
settings.body: Our line of women’s-specific products are made with care and intention to address the needs of female riders. From higher necklines, tapered waists, and our innovative droptail bib design, this collection was made to push boundaries.

settings.cl_subheader: Below is a library of all the PEARL iZUMi resources.

settings.heading: Ride there
settings.body: We believe that bikes are the ultimate vehicle for living an inspired, impactful and immersive life.

settings.title: ride 365®
settings.text: The PEARL iZUMi Ride 365 Climate System is the definitive system of dress to help you enjoy more great days on the bike. Our weather-tested performance wear and layering strategies are here to help you extend the season. Turn any day into a great day to ride.

settings.title: Pedal to Zero™
settings.text: Bikes can be a powerful tool to fight climate change. Our BikeStyle line is designed to transition between the bike and everyday life, empowering easier transportation. Every garment in the collection includes the number of miles needed to ride, instead of driving a car, to zero out its carbon footprint. You can choose to ride its climate impact out of existence.

settings.title: more trail
settings.text: Our love for mountain biking is best summed up in two words: More Trail. It’sabout pushing your boundaries to become a more complete rider and getting more out of the MTB experience. We challenged ourselves to create a line of apparel that can take your riding to the next level. And we’re committed to helping create and maintain the places where that happens, by supporting your local trailsevery time you purchase. More Trail means more possibilities.

settings.title: WE
settings.text: It’s no secret that cycling hasn’t always been the most welcoming space for women riders. But rather than dwelling on the past, WE are leading a collective charge to expand the sport of cycling. Because when we’re riding together, we have nothing to lose and everything to gain.

settings.title: here we go
settings.text: We’ve set lofty targets, yet remained focused on creating technical cycling apparel to make all of your rides better. So, join us on the trail, tarmac or gravel roads and see how far we go. Join us for the ride. Text RIDE to 27163 for early access to new releases and athlete news!

settings.title: Go Astray, Your Way
settings.text: We’re all about the gravel soundtrack—the soft static of rolling over farm roads and the chatty buzz of hardpack under our wheels. Gravel is more than a way to ride—it’s a feeling. Big skies and back roads, tight two-tracks under a tunnel of trees, and chasing adventure on mixed terrain. It puts the experience above performance, and we think that’s something we could all use a little more of in our riding.

settings.body: The best days often contain an element of the unexpected: exploring a new road, a surprise creek crossing, stumbling upon a new cafe, or just perfect weather and the right mix of friends. Gravel embodies the unexpected, and encourages us to see what’s over that next rise. Our line of gravel-geared apparel is ready to embrace the adventure with you. With features like cargo pockets, PI Dry® water-shedding treatment, moisture-wicking fabrics, and a comfortable fit that feels great hours-in, get ready to explore the groad ahead.

settings.title: Groadeo Suit
settings.text: There’s more than one way to gravel. And with more and more new gravel events coming onto the scene, we designed the Groadeo Suit for the days when performance takes precedence. Constructed from upcycled fabrics, we upgraded the features of a standard kit by adding cargo thigh pockets and PI Dry water repellency to this sleek and amazingly comfortable one-piece race machine.

settings.title: Expedition pro Bib Short
settings.text: Fact: pockets are great, and even better when paired with premium bib shorts. Made for the adventure-minded all-day rider, the Expedition PRO bibs offer a luxe fit with added functionality, including our PI Dry permanent water-repellent technology. And with support from the Levitate PRO chamois you’ll be good-to-go no matter how far you go.

settings.title: Expedition Shell Short
settings.text: Jorts may look hip, but when it comes to all-day comfort they can’t beat our new Expedition Shell Short. This slim short is constructed from lightweight, high-stretch fabric that makes it easy to access the thigh cargo pockets on our Expedition Shorts, should you choose to wear them underneath. And when things get rowdy, our permanent PI Dry technology shrugs off spray from tires and stream crossings.

settings.title: Gravel Gaiter
settings.text: Yes, gravel is a feeling. But, it’s a feeling we don’t want in our shoes. Meet the Gravel Gaiter, our solution to keeping bits of dirt, sand, and rock on the road and out of our shoes and socks. Inspired by the sleek fit of trail running gaiters and our own gravel racing debacles, this over-the-ankle essential piece of gravel protection keeps your focus on pedaling, even when the terrain turns challenging.

settings.title: Rove Tech Henley
settings.text: Our Henley has the soft feel of a worn-in favorite tee with subtle tech that makes it the ideal companion for gravel riding. We chose drirelease fabric that expertly wicks moisture and dries quickly in the face of stream crossings and spray, to keep you cool even on hot and humid days. The Rove Henley offers a casual alternative to a jersey, so you’ll be ready to go astray, your way.

settings.title: Women's Symphony Tank
settings.text: Perfect for roaming all your favorite back roads, the Symphony Tank hits the sweet spot between style and performance. A sleek alternative to a standard jersey, this tank features flattering crossover straps and a higher neckline for the best on-bike fit.

settings.title: Women's Attack Long Sleeve jersey
settings.text: Designed for long days in the sun, the Attack Long Sleeve Jersey provides protective coverage in a lightweight layer. And moisture-wicking Transfer fabric means you won’t overheat on warm days. Pair with the PRO Expedition Bib Short for the ultimate all-road kit.

settings.heading: High performance trail-wear, designed for adventure.
settings.body: What makes a perfect ride depends on the rider you’re talking to. That’s why we’ve developed collections that prioritize different features, so that you can wear what works for you.

To get the most out of every ride, finding the right cycling apparel is essential. From breathable shorts & jerseys for summer to base layers and winter gear, we have you covered.

settings.title: Women's Ride Finder
settings.text: Getting started can be the hardest part. Our women’s group ride finder is here to help you learn about riding opportunities in your area. From casual gravel spins to performance-oriented road teams and MTB meet-ups, find like-minded cyclists in your area and get rolling!

settings.cta_text_1: We champion efforts to introduce the joy of cycling to all women, but especially women and girls of color. Our goal is to provide comfortable place where lady cyclists can support, advise, organize rides and promote skill-sharing.
settings.cta_text_2: Founded in 2001, the Dirt Series hosts weekend mountain bike skills camps across the country for female-identifying, co-ed and youth-female riders. We believe that mountain biking is about having fun, being outside and getting dirty.
settings.cta_text_3: Grit Clinics employ an extensive list of talented and supportive female riders-turned-coaches nationwide so you can sign up for private coaching, or organize a private clinic (3-21 riders) on your home trails, on your own time and schedule.

settings.cta_info_1: AZ / AR / MT / OR / VT / WY
settings.cta_text_1: We love teaching everyone from brand-new beginners to advanced riders looking to level up their skills. We encourage anyone (18+) who identifies as female to join our camps (half-day to four-day) hosted in six states around the country!
settings.cta_text_2: Held in 3 three different states throughout the year, Roam Fest is a fun-first mtb festival that creates a space of acceptance for women, marginalized riders, & genderqueer femme folks to build community while riding in world class bike destinations.
settings.cta_text_3: Dirt Rock 'n Root Training is a mountain bike skills training company that offers women's-specific clinics, as well as private or group lessons for those wishing to improve their mtb skills and gain more confidence on their bikes.

settings.cta_text_1: VNTRbirds is an outdoor education company by women for women. Based in Breckenridge, we aim to teach women how to get into the outdoors safely and confidently through clinics, workshops, and free monthly GOOD VIBES ride days across the state.
settings.cta_text_2: We believe that the outdoors is a place for rad women to connect with other rad women. We empower individual athletes through gear reviews for women by women and community educational events, with a focus on bikes and backcountry skiing.
settings.cta_text_3: Our series focuses increasing riders' confidence and improving riders' understanding of the relationship between you and your bike. We offer four clinics in Colorado and one in Sedona, AZ, as well as lessons from private coaches and scholarship opportunities.

settings.cta_text_1: Sundance teaches energizing and empowering women's-specific as well as coed clinics and camps, for riders of all experience levels. We believe that building better riders starts with learning one skill at a time in a safe environment.
settings.cta_text_2: Sol Squad is a competitive women’s cycling team based in Denver-Boulder comprised of women of all ages, backgrounds, and expertise. Our team ranges from state and national champions to new moms trying to balance life and fun.
settings.cta_text_3: We are committed to empowering female athletes (with a focus on CX) to create a better culture, give team members support, coaching, and camaraderie to achieve competitive and non-competitive goals, and cultivate community through a shared love of cycling.

settings.cta_text_1: The women's mountain biking group in Santa Barbara—all levels welcome to our weekly rides, clinics and more! Come shred with us!
settings.cta_text_2: Based in Boulder with members across Colorado and even out-of-state, we welcome women cyclists to join our club! We are a collective inspired to achieve our cycling dreams through camaraderie, riding and/or racing, and sharing miles of smiles.
settings.cta_text_3: A womens'-only riding collective and race team located in Boulder, Colorado. RDC hosts several group rides per month with at least two pace groups to choose from on both road and gravel. Check our events calendar for more info!

settings.cta_text_1: Girls, Gears and Beers is a mountain biking club striving to create an inclusive and diverse cycling community. We welcome anyone who identifies as female (cis or transgender), and nonbinary and genderqueer folks who identify with the women’s community.
settings.cta_text_2: Our motto: Ride your bike, Explore your potential, and Create community—that’s us in a nutshell! Through happy hour meet-ups to longer weekend rides, our mission is to empower women and create community, on and off the bike.
settings.cta_text_3: Looking to meet other women riders in Colorado, develop your MTB skills, and expand your mechanical know-how? Come join local women for some great times on and off the bike at our weeknight rides, classes and skills clinics!

settings.cta_text_1: Bike Bash Beti will take place October 2, 2022! Joins us in Golden, CO for a day of all-women's mountain bike racing at all levels!
settings.cta_text_2: Transformative bike retreats for women using the desert around Fruita, CO as our playground. We believe in fostering positive mindsets so you can become the best version of you.
settings.cta_text_3: Held in Lyons, this is Colorado’s original all-women’s ride. Since 2008, Venus de Miles has been project of Greenhouse Scholars, with the mission of bringing women together to celebrate sisterhood, community, and a great time.

settings.cta_text_1: Idaho's premier women's-only bicycle ride, Spinderella boasts five scenic distances, ranging from 10 to 100 miles. This supported one-day ride will be held on June 18, 2022 and we encourage everyone from beginners to accomplished riders to participate!
settings.cta_text_2: Join us for PIGTAILS at Prairie Trail, a one-day women-specific ride that travels 48 miles on one of the Midwest's most scenic trails. This is a supported, point-to-point ride complete with lunch and party/snack stops!
settings.cta_text_3: This is a Facebook forum dedicated to organizing mtb and road rides and facilitating new cycling friendships. It offers a place to share ride stories, plan meetups, ask for advice or just talk bikes.

settings.cta_title_1: Brands All Women's Cycling and Mountain Biking
settings.cta_text_1: This is a non-competitive riding group on Facebook with a mission to inspire and bring women together to experience the joys of mountain biking and adventure. Rides are no-drop and organized according to skill level.
settings.cta_text_2: The Ride Life Ladies Retreat is a weekend dedicated to bringing women together to have fun on their bikes, gaining confidence on the trail, eating good food, spending time with and learning from fellow lady shredders, smiling and riding!
settings.cta_title_3: Women on Wheels in the Wissahickon
settings.cta_text_3: We are an informal riding club, for women of all levels, dedicate to encouraging more women to ride mountain bikes.  We get together weekly for a supportive, no-drop, friendly rides in the Wissahickon. We also offer monthly beginner rides.

settings.cta_text_1: Little Red is a fully supported, non-competitive, women-only cycling event to be held on June 4, 2022 in Utah's scenic Cache Valley. With six course options ranging from 17 to 100 miles, there's a ride for everyone!
settings.cta_text_2: Wildflower Outdoor is a women's cycling club that offers a full season activities for all levels. We offer weekly rides, training and education nights, and two summer women's riding festivals, the Wildflower Trailfest (MTB) and the Wildflower Pedalfest (Road).
settings.cta_text_3: Warrior Woman Ride is a non-competitive all-women ride. With two course options (15 or 30 miles) that showcase the best riding of Southern Utah County, participants will enjoy rolling hills, beautiful countryside, and scenic terrain surrounding Utah Lake!

settings.cta_text_1: Goldilocks is a non-competitive, fully supported, crazy fun, women’s bike ride. With route options including 20, 40, 60, 80 and 100 mile distances, there is a Goldilocks event that is ‘just right’ for everyone!
settings.cta_text_2:
Wednesday women's trail rides for all ability levels! Meet at the Village Sport Shop Trailside at 5pm, stay after for a beer at the Hub Trailside. Weekly rides aren't year round—call the shop first to confirm time and location! Shop info: 2099 Darling Hill Road - 
Lyndonville, VT 05851

(802) 626-8444
settings.cta_text_3: As part of the 6/12/2022 Ranger gravel ride gathering, this 18-mile no-drop gravel group ride seeks to provide a safe space for women, non-binary, and trans riders, but we welcome cis male allies to join too!

settings.cta_text_1: Moxie Monday is a weekly social ride that emphasizes community over miles for women, trans, and non-binary folks. All are welcome regardless of age or experience! We meet every Monday at Seattle's Westlake Park at 6:00pm* (*check IG for details).
settings.cta_text_2: Rowdy Gowdy is a weekend skills camp in Cheyenne, WY designed to help women improve their mtb skills, build confidence, meet local riders while having FUN in the process.  We also offer clinics around the state throughout the year.

settings.body: Our gear is inspired by nature and built for the ride, because any day on the bike is a day well spent. We’ve honed our performance fabrics and constructions for decades, so you can be confident these items will keep you riding comfortably, whatever the weather. From Wind, to Rain, to Cold, learn what protection you need so you can chase more great days.

settings.title: Wind
settings.text: Our greatest barrier to riding comfort often comes from an unseen element: the wind. Even in moderately cool still conditions, windchill created through riding has the power to rob cyclists of body heat generated from pedaling. Proper windwear helps establish a stable microclimate around the body, providing protection on blustery days or simply trapping a little extra warmth on crisper outings. Gear constructed from our lightweight and breathable Barrier fabric offer the perfect level of packable protection, so you’ll always be equipped to Ride365.

settings.title: Rain
settings.text: All too often, rain protection isn’t designed to meet the specific needs of cycling, which is a highly aerobic activity where breathability is critical. To meet the unique demands of our sport, we’re rethinking rain gear to deliver protection from water penetration while prioritizing maximum breathability (because getting wet from the inside is just as bad). Utilizing technologies like PI Dry® and newly released Polartec® Neoshell® fabrics in a bike-specific fit, our WxB gear delivers unparalleled comfort in rainy and wet conditions. So, leave the rainy-day blues behind and discover more great days to ride.

settings.title: Cold
settings.text: When it comes to riding in the cold, there’s a fine line between warm and too warm. We know because we’ve spent decades doing research with riders dedicated to extending the season. By engineering breathable protection into our fabrics we’re able to optimize the delicate balance of airflow and insulation, setting you up to build the perfect system of dress. Pedal with confidence into sub-freezing temps—our protection is built to keep pace, whatever the weather.

settings.title: Wind Protection Built for the Bike
settings.text: Our greatest barrier to riding comfort often comes from an unseen element: the wind. Even in moderately cool still conditions, wind chill created through riding has the power to rob cyclists of body heat generated from pedaling. Proper windwear helps establish a stable microclimate around the body, providing protection on blustery days or simply trapping a little extra warmth on crisper outings. Jackets constructed from our lightweight and breathable Barrier fabric offer the perfect level of packable protection, so you’ll always be equipped to ride 365.

Combined with a durable water repellent (DWR) technology, Barrier fabrics provide versatile wind protection by offering enough water shedding performance to weather brief rain showers, but with better breathability than a truly waterproof shell. Our Barrier jackets easily pack down to store in a jersey pocket, so there’s always at the ready. Make Barrier your go-to windwear and go with confidence.

PI Dry delivers water shedding performance at the fiber level, allowing us to create knit and woven fabrics that repel water regardless of how much they stretch. Water rolls off, keeping you warmer, drier, and lighter. And the best part is, it lasts longer than DWR’s, delivering full performance even after 100 washes.

settings.title: Rainwear Built for the Bike
settings.text: All too often, rain protection isn’t designed to meet the specific needs of cycling, which is a highly aerobic activity where breathability is critical. To meet the unique demands of our sport, we’re rethinking rain jackets to deliver protection from water penetration while prioritizing maximum breathability (Because getting wet from the inside is just as bad). Utilizing technologies like PI Dry® and newly released Polartec® Neoshell® fabrics in a bike-specific fit, our WxB outerwear delivers unparalleled comfort in rainy and wet conditions. So, leave the rainy-day blues behind and discover more great days to ride.

WXB fabrics are designed to protect you in a steady rain. By combining a waterproof but air-permeable membrane with taped seams, WxB jackets promise a watertight seal without sacrificing breathability. The unique fabric construction allows water vapor and warm air to escape without letting water droplets enter. The result is breathable protection, so you are less likely to overheat or feel chilled from sweat. These fabrics are combined with a durable water repellent (DWR) technology to shed precipitation and boost breathability.

Polartec Neoshell provides 3D breathability through an electro-spun membrane that allows more dynamic airflow. This cutting-edge fabric lets excess body heat out without letting outside moisture in. The result is rainwear that breathes before you overheat, making it ideal for cycling.

PI Dry delivers water shedding performance at the fiber level, allowing us to create knit and woven fabrics that repel water regardless of how much they stretch. Water rolls off, keeping you warmer, drier, and lighter. And the best part is, it lasts longer than DWR’s, delivering full performance even after 100 washes.

settings.title: Gear up to Enjoy the Cold
settings.text: When it comes to riding in the cold, there’s a fine line between warm and too warm. We know because we’ve spent decades doing research with riders dedicated to extending the season. By engineering breathable protection into our fabrics, we’re able to optimize the delicate balance of airflow and insulation, setting you up to build the perfect layering system. So, pedal with confidence into sub-freezing temps—our protection is built to keep pace, whatever the weather.

Ideal for winter or cool-wet conditions, AmFIB softshell fabrics combine breathable protection from wind and water with lofted fibers to retain body heat. While these fabrics provide substantial moisture protection, they emphasize breathability and are not fully waterproof. Garments made with AmFIB provide consistent comfort through a range of cool-to-cold conditions so you can minimize layering adjustments, which means more time pedaling.

PI Dry delivers water shedding performance at the fiber level, allowing us to create knit and woven fabrics that repel water regardless of how much they stretch. Water rolls off, keeping you warmer, drier, and lighter. And the best part is, it lasts longer than DWR’s, delivering full performance even after 100 washes.

settings.heading: A System Inspired by Nature, Built for the Ride
settings.body:
Crafting truly breathable, multi-layer protection that’s bike-specific is a tricky
business. It requires precisely balancing thermoregulation for the rider while
still providing protection from the outside elements. Add in more variables,
like truly frigid temperatures, wet conditions, or humidity, and the plot
thickens. Through decades of testing and more recent simulations in the ACE
Climatic Wind Tunnel, we’ve developed an innovative system of dress that nails
both protection and breathability. By combining the warmth-regulating
properties of a Polartec Alpha® layer and the breathable water protection of
Polartec NeoShell®, our PRO Layering System was born.

settings.title: Rainwear with Game-Changing Versatility
settings.text: We’re redefining rainwear for cycling and creating a more versatile, breathable solution using the cutting-edge technical fabric, Polartec NeoShell. Traditional technical rainwear utilizes a microporous membrane, with holes too small for water droplets to penetrate yet large enough for water vapor to escape, resulting in a semi-breathable jacket. But this tech has limits, causing most riders to leave their waterproof shells in the closet unless it's actively raining. NeoShell changes the narrative by providing 3D breathability through an electro-spun membrane that creates more dynamic airflow. This game-changing fabric lets excess body heat out without letting outside moisture in. The result is PRO-tuned protection with the versatility to become a go-to shell even in dry conditions.

settings.title: Next-Level Layering
settings.text: Best used as a base or mid layer, the PRO Alpha Layer employs active insulation to deliver consistent warmth across variable conditions throughout the ride. Worn next to skin, this piece feels luxurious and deftly moves moisture away from the body while retaining the perfect amount of warmth. When the forecast calls for truly arctic temps, wear it as a breathable mid layer in tandem with a baselayer, to draw away more sweat than a typical thermal jersey while still retaining body heat beneath a shell. For comfort that keeps pace, whatever the weather, go PRO Alpha.

settings.title: Foundational Comfort
settings.text: In colder weather, the best next-to-skin layer is the Transfer Merino Baselayer. Our hybrid design places wool on the exterior to facilitate efficient moisture management and thermoregulation. At the same time, a synthetic fabric faces inward to minimize bulk and create a high-stretch form-fitting base. The unique properties of merino make it a superior insulating and wicking material that still provides warmth even when wet. And thanks to the natural odor resistance of the wool, you can hang dry for another ride before washing.

settings.title: cool
settings.text: Our three-season line-up of cold weather mountain bike gear dials breathability, so you’ll spend less time shedding layers and more time shredding singletrack. Get ready to charge the climbs, rip the descents, and keep rolling whatever the weather. The right gear is all you need to extend the season.

settings.title: cold & windy
settings.text: When the trees lose their leaves and the wind whips through the forest, it’s nice to have a little extra protection from the elements. Gear like the Summit AmFIB® Lite pants adds wind and water protection where it’s needed most while still prioritizing breathability. Up top, a thermal baselayer pairs perfectly with the new Summit ECOLoft™ Vest or super-packable Summit PRO Barrier Jacket. And don’t forget something for your ears and extremities, like the warm-yet-precise Summit Alpha Glove and cozy Merino Thermal socks.

settings.title: wet
settings.text: If winter in your neck of the woods means rain instead of snow, shifting into the dark months is more about staying dry to keep comfortable. Our WxB gear is designed to help you maintain a stable microclimate, providing rain protection while prioritizing breathability. A jacket with an over helmet hood, like the Summit PRO Neoshell®, prevents water from running down your back on the trail and adds surprising comfort. The new Summit WrX Neoshell glove keeps your digits drier so you can hit your brake points with confidence.

settings.title: deep winter
settings.text: Riding deep in the winter months can leave you feeling you’re somehow cheating the system and getting bonus trail days. The truth is, with a smart layering strategy and the right gear, it can be some of the most rewarding riding of the year. When winter hits, riders have been turning to AmFIB softshell for decades. Items like the Summit AmFIB Alpha pant and Canyon ECOLoft Jacket provide the perfect balance of insulation and ventilation, so trail efforts don’t leave you clammy an hour into the ride. Add shoecovers, under helmet ear protection, and our legendary winter gloves, and you’re ready for the trails on even the coldest days.

settings.heading: The PEARL iZUMi Experience
settings.body: For over 20 years, the PEARL iZUMi Factory Stores have offered the most comprehensive selection of PEARL iZUMi gear in the world. Ideally situated in the mountains, this brand store is stocked with PEARL iZUMi gear offerings from past seasons at outlet pricing and also carries tons of current season gear. The stores are staffed by knowledgeable experts who delight in outfitting guests for their upcoming adventures on bikes. Whether you’re a beginning cyclist who needs honest advice on how to increase the role of bicycles in your life or a seasoned rider looking for gear that will give you a performance edge, our team will listen carefully and make thoughtful suggestions to help you select just the right gear to make your cycling adventures the best experience possible. Stop by and experience PEARL iZUMi.

settings.name: PRO Levitate Chamois
settings.title: PRO Levitate Chamois
settings.description:
The pinnacle of comfort and performance, this chamois pad offers more support with better stretch and breathability than any on the market. The PRO Next-Gen Suspension Core® uses ultra-high-density layers to distribute your body weight over a larger area for more comfort, even deep into a ride when most chamois are packed out. It features our softest, highest stretch 1:1 Boundary Layer that moves with you in and out of the saddle to minimize friction. Whether you’re riding for one hour or twelve, nothing rides better.

LEVITATE CHAMOIS SERIES

The Levitate family represents our latest innovation in chamois technology. By combining a multi-density Suspension Core™, super-soft 1:1® Boundary Layer top sheet, and seamless Infinite Edge™ transition, the Levitate lets you float through road and trail chatter so you’ll never bottom out.

REDUCE FRICTION: Cycling is repetitive, so we use high stretch materials, soft face fabrics, and an innovative floating top layer to smooth the movement between your body and the saddle.

PROVIDE SUPPORT: While riding, a considerable amount of weight is concentrated on the sit bones, which are about the size of a quarter. Our suspension core design distributes this pressure evenly across a wider area to prevent hot spots and improve long-distance comfort.

KEEP SKIN DRY: We choose specialized, highly breathable layers to allow moisture to move freely away from your body, maintaining skin health and a chafe-free riding experience.

settings.name: ELITE Levitate Chamois
settings.title: ELITE Levitate Chamois
settings.description:
With a ride quality similar to the PRO, this chamois pad delivers comfort and performance that’s on par or better than most high-end offerings. The ELITE Next-Gen Suspension Core uses high-density layers to distribute your body weight over a larger area for more comfort, even deep into a ride when most chamois are packed out. It features a moisture-wicking 1:1 Boundary Layer that moves with you in and out of the saddle to minimize friction. This is a daily driver chamois that is ready to go the distance.

LEVITATE CHAMOIS SERIES

The Levitate family represents our latest innovation in chamois technology. By combining a multi-density Suspension Core™, super-soft 1:1® Boundary Layer top sheet, and seamless Infinite Edge™ transition, the Levitate lets you float through road and trail chatter so you’ll never bottom out.

REDUCE FRICTION

Cycling is repetitive, so we use high stretch materials, soft face fabrics, and an innovative floating top layer to smooth the movement between your body and the saddle.

PROVIDE SUPPORT

While riding, a considerable amount of weight is concentrated on the sit bones, which are about the size of a quarter. Our suspension core design distributes this pressure evenly across a wider area to prevent hot spots and improve long-distance comfort.

KEEP SKIN DRY

We choose specialized, highly breathable layers to allow moisture to move freely away from your body, maintaining skin health and a chafe-free riding experience.

settings.name: SELECT Levitate Chamois
settings.title: SELECT Levitate Chamois
settings.description:
Based on the same design philosophy as the more premium PRO and ELITE, this chamois pad delivers incredible performance at a more accessible price point. The key difference is that it’s cut from a single layer of medium-density material, with a thicker cross-section providing comfortable support to the most high-pressure areas. An integrated boundary layer keeps soft, fast-drying fabric next to the skin to minimize friction. This chamois punches above its weight, delivering a ride on par with most mid-range offerings.

LEVITATE CHAMOIS SERIES

The Levitate family represents our latest innovation in chamois technology. By combining a multi-density Suspension Core™, super-soft 1:1® Boundary Layer top sheet, and seamless Infinite Edge™ transition, the Levitate lets you float through road and trail chatter so you’ll never bottom out.

We choose specialized, highly breathable layers to allow moisture to move freely away from your body, maintaining skin health and a chafe-free riding experience.

settings.name: Pedal to Zero
settings.title: Pedal to Zero
settings.description: We calculated the Pedal to Zero number using the EPA’s estimate that a typical passenger car produces 404 grams of CO2 per mile. For example, our Rove Short creates the equivalent of 9.8kg of CO2*. Therefore, if you ride 24 miles instead of driving, you’ve zeroed out the emissions impact of the Rove Short. This knowledge can inspire us to change our behavior. *This information was calculated by PEARL iZUMi using the Higg Product Module 2.0 at Higg.org. It includes cradle-to-gate impacts only.

settings.name: In-R-Cool Infrared
settings.title: In-R-Cool Infrared
settings.description: In-R-Cool Infrared technology utilizes advanced fabric construction and design to enhance the cooling effect for riders during intense activities. It features infrared-reflective yarns embedded into the fabric. This method reflects the sun's rays, effectively reducing the fabric's surface temperature, thus keeping the rider cooler in hot conditions. Additionally, this technology helps in managing moisture and promoting quick drying, enhancing comfort and performance.

settings.name: In-R-Cool Sweat Activated
settings.title: In-R-Cool Sweat Activated
settings.description: In-R-Cool technology helps keep you in the comfort zone when the mercury rises so that you can perform better in hot conditions. In-R-Cool boosts the natural cooling properties of our technical Transfer fabrics beyond simple sweat evaporation without changing the look or texture.

settings.name: PI Dry®
settings.title: PI Dry®
settings.description: PI Dry® is a proprietary technology developed to enhance the performance and comfort of cycling gear. This technology provides a permanent water-shedding treatment that is applied to fabrics at the fiber level, making them resistant to saturation from rain or road spray. Unlike other treatments that can wash out over time, PI Dry® ensures that each fiber is coated with a hydrophobic treatment before the fabric is woven or knit, ensuring that the performance is built to last, not just seasonally but for the life of the garment. This feature is ideal for all-weather conditions, enabling riders to stay dry and comfortable in various climates, ultimately enhancing their riding experience and performance.

settings.name: Polartec® Neoshell®
settings.title: Polartec® Neoshell®
settings.description: Polartec® Neoshell® is a revolutionary fabric technology that provides an exceptional combination of waterproof and breathable performance. This cutting-edge material is designed for the most demanding environments, offering cyclists and other athletes unparalleled protection against the elements while maintaining a high level of air permeability. This means that while it blocks out water and wind, it also allows sweat vapor to escape, keeping the wearer dry and comfortable during intense activities. The unique construction of Neoshell® enhances the wearer's thermoregulation, making it an ideal choice for activities that demand rigorous movement and exposure to harsh weather conditions.

settings.name: AmFIB® Lite Softshell
settings.title: AmFIB® Lite Softshell
settings.description: AmFIB® Lite Softshell is a high-performance fabric technology designed for ultimate lightweight flexibility and protection. This innovative softshell material strikes an excellent balance between warmth and breathability, making it ideal for cold-weather cycling without the bulk typically associated with winter gear. Its soft, stretchable qualities ensure a comfortable, form-fitting wear, while its water-resistant properties help keep the elements at bay. AmFIB® Lite Softshell is perfect for riders who demand high mobility and weather protection in their cycling apparel.

settings.name: AmFIB® Thermal Softshell
settings.title: AmFIB® Thermal Softshell
settings.description: The AmFIB® Thermal Softshell is a cutting-edge fabric technology designed to optimize comfort and performance in cold-weather cycling conditions. The fabric combines a thermal fleece on the inside for warmth with a weather-resistant softshell exterior that blocks wind and repels water, ensuring riders stay dry and comfortable. AmFIB® is engineered for durability and flexibility, allowing for a full range of motion while maintaining breathability. This makes it ideal for cyclists who refuse to let the harsher conditions of winter stop their riding adventures.

settings.name: Polartec® Alpha® Direct
settings.title: Polartec® Alpha® Direct
settings.description: Polartec® Alpha® Direct is an advanced insulation technology designed for versatility and performance in outdoor apparel. This innovative material is specifically engineered to provide superior warmth and breathability, making it ideal for activities that involve fluctuating temperatures. Unlike traditional insulation, Polartec® Alpha® Direct is designed to be used without the need for a separate liner, allowing it to be in direct contact with other layers or the skin, which enhances moisture vapor transmission and reduces overall garment weight. This results in a more comfortable and adaptable garment that excels in a variety of weather conditions, making it perfect for cyclists and outdoor enthusiasts who require functional, adaptable, and lightweight apparel.

settings.name: PrimaLoft® Gold
settings.title: PrimaLoft® Gold
settings.description: PrimaLoft® Gold is the premier microfiber insulation material renowned for its lightweight yet robust heat retention capabilities. It delivers outstanding warmth without the bulk, mimicking the warmth and compressibility of down while providing superior wet-weather performance. PrimaLoft® Gold is highly breathable, packable, and exceptionally soft, making it the preferred choice for premium outerwear, gloves, and sleeping bags where maintaining warmth in damp conditions is crucial. Its ultra-fine fibers form tiny air pockets that trap body heat and keep the cold out, ensuring optimal thermal efficiency even when wet. This insulation is also environmentally conscious, often made with post-consumer recycled materials, further enhancing its appeal to those prioritizing sustainability alongside performance.

settings.name: WxB 2.5L Membrane
settings.title: WxB 2.5L Membrane
settings.description: The WxB 2.5L Membrane is a high-performance fabric technology designed to enhance the rider's experience in adverse weather conditions. This innovative membrane consists of 2.5 layers that offer superior waterproof and breathable properties, ensuring riders stay dry and comfortable. The outer layer is treated with a Durable Water Repellent (DWR) finish to repel water, while the middle layer incorporates a breathable waterproof membrane that blocks moisture from entering and allows sweat vapor to escape. This technology is crucial for maintaining optimal comfort and protection during rainy or wet conditions, making it ideal for dedicated cyclists who ride regardless of the weather.

settings.name: WxB 3L Membrane
settings.title: WxB 3L Membrane
settings.description: The WxB 3L Membrane is a high-performance material designed to provide exceptional weather protection and breathability for cyclists. This three-layer membrane is designed to be waterproof, breathable, and windproof, providing ultimate protection against the elements. The outer layer repels water and blocks wind, while the middle membrane allows vapor to escape, ensuring that moisture does not accumulate inside the garment. This functionality not only keeps the rider dry from external moisture but also prevents overheating and sweat buildup, making it ideal for challenging weather conditions.

settings.name: GoFresh
settings.title: GoFresh
settings.description: GoFresh anti-microbial technology is a cutting-edge feature integrated into their cycling apparel to enhance rider comfort and hygiene. This technology uses anti-microbial agents embedded within the fabric to combat odor-causing bacteria, ensuring the garments remain fresh and odor-free, even after extensive use. The incorporation of GoFresh technology not only helps maintain the apparel's cleanliness and smell but also extends the wearability of the garments between washes, making it ideal for cyclists who face long hours on the road and varied environmental conditions.

settings.name: D3O® Ghost™
settings.title: D3O® Ghost™
settings.description: D3O® Ghost™ is an innovative material technology specifically designed for cyclists who seek the ultimate balance between protection and comfort. This cutting-edge material is exceptionally lightweight and flexible, making it almost imperceptible when worn, yet provides robust impact protection that hardens on impact. The D3O® Ghost™ technology is engineered to absorb and distribute energy during a crash, significantly reducing the risk of injury.

settings.name: D3O® 3D Molded
settings.title: D3O® 3D Molded
settings.description: D3O® 3D Molded is a cutting-edge material technology. This technology integrates 3D molding processes with D3O®'s patented shock-absorbing materials to enhance rider safety and comfort. The resulting products offer superior protection without compromising on flexibility or comfort, making it ideal for dynamic and challenging cycling environments. D3O® 3D Molded pads are strategically placed in high-impact areas to absorb shocks and reduce the risk of injuries, ensuring that riders can tackle any trail or road with confidence and security.

settings.name: D3O® Sheet
settings.title: D3O® Sheet
settings.description: The D3O® Sheet technology is a cutting-edge material designed for high-performance impact protection. This lightweight, flexible sheet incorporates D3O®'s unique patented technology, which allows it to remain soft and flexible under normal conditions but instantly stiffens upon impact to absorb and disperse energy. This characteristic makes it ideal for cycling, where both comfort and protection are paramount. D3O® enhances rider safety without compromising on freedom of movement, ensuring that cyclists can enjoy their rides with an added layer of security against potential impacts.

settings.name: D3O® Thin Sheet
settings.title: D3O® Thin Sheet
settings.description: The D3O® Thin Sheet technology represents a sophisticated approach to impact protection. This material is crafted from a unique polymer composite that behaves differently under various forces: it flows freely under normal conditions for comfort and flexibility but locks together upon impact to absorb and disperse energy. This dual nature provides superior protection without adding significant bulk or restricting the freedom of movement, making it ideal for cycling where performance and safety are paramount.
